channel.title: math.LO updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.LO updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Martin's Maximum${}^{\ast, ++}_{\mathfrak{c}}$ in $\mathbb{P}_{\max}$ extensions of strong models of determinacy
item.description: arXiv:2404.12836v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study a strengthening of $\mathrm{MM}^{++}$ which is called $\mathrm{MM}^{\ast, ++}$ and which was introduced by Asper\'o and Schindler. We force its bounded version $\mathrm{MM}^{\ast, ++}_{\mathfrak{c}}$, which is stronger than both $\mathrm{MM}^{++}(\mathfrak{c})$ as well as $\mathrm{BMM}^{++}$, by $\mathbb{P}_{\max}$ forcing over a determinacy model $L^{F_{\mathrm{uB}}}({\mathbb R}^*,\mbox{Hom}^{\ast})$. The construction of the ground model $L^{F_{\mathrm{uB}}}({\mathbb R}^{\ast},\mbox{Hom}^{\ast})$ builds upon Gappo and Sargsyan, and the derived model construction of Larson, Sargsyan, and Wilson.
item.dc:creator: Ralf Schindler, Taichi Yasuda

item.title: Proper and Improper Variants of Mathias and Silver Forcing
item.description: arXiv:2311.01005v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper we answer several questions in arXiv:2102.06009 regarding density variants of Mathias and Silver forcing. These questions include whether each of the forcing is proper, add dominating real, or add Cohen real. We also generalize one of the proofs to Mathias forcings parametrized by lower semi-continuous submeasures satisfying certain properties.
item.dc:creator: Shixiao Liu

item.title: A remark on $\mathscr{C}^\infty$ definable equivalence
item.description: arXiv:2403.03164v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We establish that if a submanifold $M$ of $\mathbb{R}^n$ is definable in some o-minimal structure then any definable submanifold $N\subset \mathbb{R}^n$ which is $\mathscr{C}^\infty$ diffeomorphic to $M$, with a diffeomorphism $h:N\to M$ that is sufficiently close to the identity, must be $\mathscr{C}^\infty$ definably diffeomorphic to $M$. The definable diffeomorphism between $N$ and $M$ is then provided by a tubular neighborhood of $M$.
item.dc:creator: Anna Valette, Guillaume Valette
